Detailed Description

The ResourceManager class handles all of the resources used throughout the duration of a game.

Resources include textures and models.

ResourceManager is a singleton, and can be accessed by ResourceManager\instance()

Author:
Ben Constable, original Java code by Oli Winks
Version:
1.0

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ResourceManager::ResourceManager (  ) [private]

Default constructor.

Creates empty maps of textures and models.

Copying is not supported as this is a singleton.

Member Function Documentation

void ResourceManager::addModel ( const char *  filename,
Visual3D  mod 
)

Add the given model to the ResourceManager.

If a model with the given filename already exists in the ResourceManager, this model is not added.

Parameters:
filenamefilename of model to add
modModel to add
void ResourceManager::addTexture ( const char *  filename,
SPtr< Texture > &  tex 
)

Add a Texture to the ResourceManager.

Retrievable by the given filename.

Texture does not get added if the key already exists in the map.

Parameters:
filenamefilename to associate this Texture with
texTexture to add
void ResourceManager::createTexture ( const char *  filename,
int *  width,
int *  height,
void **  data,
int  numOfBitmaps 
)

Creates and adds a Texture to the ResourceManager.

This function can be used to make Texture loading easier.

Parameters:
filenamename of Texture
widtharray of widths for each image
heightarray of heights for each image
data2D data array, each row is one image
numOfBitmapsnumber of bitmaps composing this Texture
Visual3D ResourceManager::getModel ( const char *  filename )

Retrieve a clone of the model with the given filename from the list.

This means that visual and transformation data can be modified without affecting other instances of the model.

If a model with the given filename does not exist in the ResourceManager, a null pointer is returned.

Parameters:
filenamefilename of model to retrieve
Returns:
Model clone
Visual3D ResourceManager::getModelActual ( const char *  filename )

Return the actual model with the given filename, so that it's visual and transformation data can be modified directly.

If a model with the given filename does not exist in the ResourceManager, a null pointer is returned.

Parameters:
filenamefilename of model to retrieve
Returns:
Model
SPtr<ArrayList<Visual3D> > ResourceManager::getModels (  )

Return all of the models in the ResourceMananger in an ArrayList.

NOTE: This list does not support element removal!

Returns:
Models in an ArrayList
SPtr<Texture> ResourceManager::getTexture ( const char *  filename )

Retrieve the Texture with the given filename from the ResourceManager.

If the Texture doesn't exist, a null pointer is returned.

Parameters:
filenamefilename of Texture to get
Returns:
Texture
SPtr<ArrayList<SPtr<Texture> > > ResourceManager::getTextures (  )
